jobDescription: Opportunity at a GlanceAs a Data Analyst for Chamberlain University, your primary responsibility is management of the data collection process. This including the manipulation and statistical analysis of multiple data sets, including sets that are both internal and external to the College. You are responsible for performing statistical analyses and translating the findings into conclusions and recommendations that can be understood by a non-technical audience.Responsibilities Collect/extract student-level data from various data sources, including student and faculty data (OSS), third party vendors, faculty and staff as well as other sources. You utilize various software and hardware interfaces including, but not limited to, OSS, Banner, and SQL.Merge data from multiple data sets using matching variables to create larger data sets.Develop new databases and data elements.Conduct quality checks on the completeness and accuracy of data pulled and merged into larger files.Perform statistical analyses on merged data sets using SPSS/PASW software.Present findings of analysis in non-technical terms that can be understood by a wider audience.Interface with IT project management office and IT personnel to ensure creation of the institution data warehouse - according to specifications and institution requirements.Merge campus-level and on-line program course schedules to create master schedule.Attend and participate in technical and other training.Assist with the writing and presentation of surveys and reports.Complete other duties as assigned. QualificationsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Below are the minimum requirements of the education, experience, knowledge, and skills required to competently perform in this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, market research, educational research or related field is required. A Masters degree is preferred.A minimum of two years experience working with relational databases, preferably in an educational setting.Strong analytical skills.The ability to present complicated information in understandable terms.Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, SPSS, Access, relational databases, SQL required.Knowledge of Oracle Student System, Banner or Campus View student data platforms preferred.Knowledge of and experience using web-enabled survey platforms such as Insight Express, SurveyMonkey preferred.Experience with Sales Force.com and SharePoint, MS Power BI and R preferred.Experience working with a portfolio of multiple projects is highly desired.Ability to interact with personnel at all levels of an organization is highly desired. We are proud to be an EEO employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. Thank you for applying for this outstanding opportunity today.Who We AreThe purpose of Adtalem Global Education is to empower students to achieve their goals, find success, and make inspiring contributions to our global community. Adtalem Global Education Inc. (NYSE: ATGE; member S&P; MidCap 400 Index) is a leading global education provider and the parent organization of Adtalem Educacional do Brasil, American University of the Caribbean School of Medicine, Becker Professional Education, Carrington College, Chamberlain University, DeVry University and its Keller Graduate School of Management, Ross University School of Medicine and Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine. For more information, please visit adtalem.com.
